name: KNOW THYSELF - LIMITED 1/25
description: 'Know Thyself' is a Limited 1/25 Proper Modern collab with author and journalist Chas Smith who captured this loaded scene on an NYC subway platform. Chas is editor at large at Surfing Magazine, contributes to Stab, Vice, GQ, Blackbook and the New York Times T Magazine and has just released his new book Welcome to Paradise, Now Go To Hell 'A True Story of Violence, Corruption, and the Soul of Surfing'   now available at blackincbooks.com and massive online retailers all over the wild wild web. @chasdontsurf for instagiggles. - Full-colour print on our white American Apparel poly-cotton tee. - drirelease® fabric features FreshGuard, a natural odour neutralizer that prevents odour causing bacteria from cultivating in the garment. - Double-quick drying. name: AQUABATICS
description: The Aquabatic Fencing Association was founded in the late 1930's, based at the old Life Boat Station at Waxham. It served as a sanctuary for teens and young adults, not only allowing them to pursue their athletic endeavors, but also providing a much needed social gathering place for the previously dispirate local communities in the area. In order to ward off the chill of the North Sea in an era before neoprene, the young men and women would don full length wollen bathing suits (inclusive of boots, gloves and balaclava hood) and proceed to do sub-aquatic battle, armed with noting more than a snorkel, primitive swimming goggles and a fencing foil. Although a sporting and social club in its intention, matches would oft become heated, and documentation from the time attests to impassioned confrontations where particpants would lay down their foils in favour of any other weaponry to hand- most typically making a rush for the Club's Anchor. The Club closed doors shortly after the outbreak of the Second World War, when the vast majority of the young men of the club were called to service- in the main to the Navy, having to a man been noted for their excellent skills in 'mano a mano' combat and superb comfort in the aquatic environment. Today, all that remains of the organisation is the Club's Anchor, displayed in the dusty corner of a local Public House; the memories of fencers past commemorated in it's weathered and rusting facade, a ghostly reminder of battles won and lost beneath the steely grey veneer of the North Sea. - Single-colour charcoal print on our American Apparel poly-cotton tees. - drirelease® fabric features FreshGuard, a natural odour neutralizer that prevents odour causing bacteria from cultivating in the garment. (White only) - Double-quick drying. No need to iron.

name: YOU'LL NEVER SURF ALONE
description: The 'offically unoffical' Newquay Surfboarding Club Tee. "I reckon the united passion expressed by LFC fans is unrivalled by any other sports fans in the world. My passion for Premiership football waned well before Rooney showed up though and I've become pretty jaded by the whole business sport. But standing in The Kop at Anfield during a chorus of 'You'll Never Walk Alone" is an instant cure for that grumbling cynicism. For me, actually going to a game has much the same effect as actually going surfing; the big-business, the celebrity and advertising, the fashion/lifestyle hype, all get washed-away by kick-off and the first few duck-dives of a paddle out. Which brings me to Newquay, a place that has been know to occasionally receive my appreciation...only from the sea though mind. My passion for being there on such occasions is huge and mostly it's the stuff that keeps me living. Yet it rarely seems anything more than personal stoke. At best I'll share it with a few close friends, or rarer still, with one or two strangers, but even then it's still mostly an internal thing and by Anfield standards it's a non event: the 45,522 of us sharing a few peaks at Fistral don't ever stand with hand-on-heart and exhale an anthemic chorus from deep within our souls, waving our towels with pride above our heads in the car park..." Josh At least now though, you can pay hommage in style to those rare glorious occasions that you've spent immersed in one of Newquay's summer-brine line-ups. Even if every wave is a party wave - swollen with washed-up stag-do'ers and hens-done; the pasty-fattened Flotsam and pals Jetsam, Lagen and Derelict. Visit Newquay - "You'll Never Surf Alone" - Single-colour charcoal print on our American Apparel poly-cotton tees. - drirelease® fabric features FreshGuard, a natural odour neutralizer that prevents odour causing bacteria from cultivating in the garment. (White only) - Double-quick drying. No need to iron.

name: REMINDER
description: "What the heck are you doing? You're gonna be dead a real long time" That' s what David Carson said once at the end of a lecture he gave. Luckily someone recorded it and then later-on the internerd let TED tell me about it. It's a sentiment I like to keep swimming about my head but it climbs out of its own accord every now and then. 'Reminder' is it's latest incarnation. - Single-colour charcoal print on our American Apparel poly-cotton tees. - drirelease® fabric features FreshGuard, a natural odour neutralizer that prevents odour causing bacteria from cultivating in the garment. (White only) - Double-quick drying. No need to iron.

name: YES CHEF!
description: "TOO MANY KOOKS SPOIL THE FROTH" "It's an age-old problem that's been debated globally for literally thousands of...days. Late 1940's US President Harry S. Truman must have 'pre-visioned' the whole surf-localism issue and our T-shirt response when he suggested that if you can't stand the heat, you should probably get out of the kitchen. To echo Trumans sentiment and offer our own solution we suggest the following: Don't be another Kook! Don't carve the words "Locals Only" (especially not with a paddle) into anything, ever. Just get out of the water if you become frustrated. Pull on this passive-aggressive Tee and feel good that you can express your frustrations and veiled-hostility in a childish yet totally acceptable manor without spoiling anyones froth." - Full-colour print on our white American Apparel poly-cotton tee. - drirelease® fabric features FreshGuard, a natural odour neutralizer that prevents odour causing bacteria from cultivating in the garment. - Double-quick drying. No need to iron.

name: STAY ADRIFT
description: Josh was over in Byron Bay, Australia earlier in the year; hanging out and gleaning all the screen-printing knowledge he could from local print hero Rafe Cross at the Adrift Print Shop. This design was originally hand-pulled as a 4 colour silk-screen print at the Adrift studio. Of the 25 printed, 12 made there way back to the UK and they sold out super quick-smart over here. So for all you kind folks who've been asking for it, here's our full-colour version of the design. If you're in Australia you might still be able to get your hands on one of the originals over at www.adriftprint.com.au - Full-colour print on our white American Apparel poly-cotton tee. - drirelease® fabric features FreshGuard, a natural odour neutralizer that prevents odour causing bacteria from cultivating in the garment. - Double-quick drying. No need to iron.

name: Pocket Knife
description:
Great for stabbing bread/cheese/apple, sharpening sticks to poke through marshmellows, honing the point of yer pencil...surprise haircuts and hacking through thick mullets...

Available with or without handy leather case. 

These knives and cases are made by real people with real hands from real dead trees and various deceased creatures. Therefore colours many vary slightly.

name: Side Tables
description:
Nest of three handmade side tables.

Small 12" x 12" x16"high
Mid 12" x 16" x 18"high
Large 12" x 20" 20"high

These table inlays are made from driftwood that washed up on Porthtowan, Praa Sands and Hayle a few winters back. Whitewashed pine frames and legs.

name: Beer Coasters/Mats (RAW)
description:
Set of 6 handmade beer mats for yer beer or tuther beverage to rest upon...
Each set comprises 3x skulls and 3x ...the other kind (see photos).

Made from 4mm best quality grade Baltic Birch plywood
Approximate size 3.5 inches (9 centimetres) square.

These mats have intentionally been left unvarnished. They dont wanna be sitting there sweating, nervously hiding under a plastic coat of varnish. They want to age, have beer spilled over them when your mates are around and rest dutifully under their pints, protecting nervous tables and being all old and wise and getting older as you're sitting there drinking beer and... talking shit.

name: Beer Coasters/Mats (PAINTED)
description:
Set of 6 handmade beer mats for yer beverages to rest on...
Each set comprises 3x Skulls and 3x ...the other kind (see photos).

Made from 4mm best quality grade Baltic Birch plywood
Approximate size 3.5 inches (9 centimetres) square.

This set has been handpainted and comes in a 'reclaimed' finish (its knackered and looks like its been around a while).
The coasters have intentionally been left unvarnished. They dont wanna be sitting there sweating, nervously hiding under a plastic coat of varnish. They want to age, have beer spilled over them when your mates are round and rest dutifully under their pints, protecting nervous tables and being all old and wise and getting older as you're sitting there drinking beer and... talking shit.
